column35: The Arizona Constitution provides for merit selection (Nominating Commission and Gub. Appt) and retention (retention election) of judges in counties with populations of 250,000 or greater. Currently, this includes Maricopa, Pima and Pinal Counties. Counties whose populations are less than 250,000 may adopt merit selection through ballot initiative.

column41: No forced retirement age/term limit, but judge loses retirement benefits if elected or appointed to judicial office after age 70, unless additional term required to have sufficient credited service to retire.

column23: If Gov doesn't appoint within 30 days, or the Senate reject's the Gov's appointment, the JNC appoints with the consent of the Senate.

column12: A person appointed to fill a vacancy 60 or more days prior to the next primary election to nominate Judges shall serve until the vacancy is filled for a term at the next general or judicial election. A person appointed to fill a vacancy less than 60 days prior to the next primary election to nominate Judges shall serve until the vacancy is filled at the second general or judicial election following such appointment.
the first general election following an appointment

column35: In 17 districts, judges are selected by gubernatorial appointment from a nominating commission. Judges in those districts run for additional terms in unopposed retention elections. In the other 14 districts, judges are selected in partisan elections.

column23: The Superior Court, Appellate Division judges are assigned from the Superior Court by the Supreme Court. Superior Court judges are nominated by the governor and confirmed by the Senate. Nominating commission used for candidates for the Superior Court and not used for elevating judges to the Appellate Division.

column12: At next general election held more than 3 months after vacancy occurs.
column23: Candidates are nominated at party convention. Of the justices elected to the supreme court (trial court), Gov designates which judges will be part of the appellate division

column12: At next election held more than 60 days after the vacancy occurred
At next general election after serving 2 years. BUT- if serves more than 2 years, subsequently elected judge then has term reduced to the number of years remaining in the subsequent term.
At next general election, where successor is elected for unexpired term. EXCEPT when unexpired term ends within a year of the next general election, the appointment is for the entire unexpired term.
